{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dopamine is a medication that acts on different receptors at different infusion rates. At low infusion rates of 3-5 mcg/kg/min, dopamine primarily acts on dopamine receptors. Dopamine stimulation of dopamine receptors leads to vasodilation in renal, mesenteric, and coronary arteries. This results in increased blood flow to the kidneys and other organs. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Increased renal blood flow.", "answer_choice": "B"}
